segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t react at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just tired or really that focused on the dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed the mess yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are right behind her, and she has no idea what they’re up to.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to end badly if someone doesn’t step in soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost want to shout and warn her, but I know she wouldn’t hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR
